intro: Limonium carpetanicum, commonly known as the carpet sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Limonium carpetanicum is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
